main event: On March 6, 1969, a witness observed a bright circular light in the sky that hovered and then moved rapidly northward before disappearing.
interesting points: The sighting lasted approximately 1 minute and the object appeared to be about 1 mile in diameter., The object hovered silently, then moved quickly to the north., The witness was accompanied by their family during the sighting., The light was described as yellowish-white and much larger than a star or planet., The observation was made from Billings, Oklahoma, under clear skies.
witness description: Joseph B. Thomas and his family
